metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11556 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Pagure before 5.6 allows XSS via the templates/blame.html blame view.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11556` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pagure - 5.8.1+dfsg-3
pagure-ci - 5.8.1+dfsg-3
pagure-ev-server - 5.8.1+dfsg-3
pagure-loadjson - 5.8.1+dfsg-3
pagure-logcom - 5.8.1+dfsg-3
pagure-milters - 5.8.1+dfsg-3
pagure-mirror - 5.8.1+dfsg-3
pagure-webhook - 5.8.1+dfsg-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pagure package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.8.1+dfsg-3').
